page.title: 02WIBTOFT CHAPEL 1
page.content: The proper name is The Chapel of the Ascension of the Blessed Virgin Mary (Church of England). First known to exist in 1004, Ulfic spot gave it to another Viking Athelric, in a will. Name of present vicar Rev. Haddelsy The Chapel is in the diocese of Leicester although it in Warwickshire, because, of the watershed. A stream in Wibtoft goes to the Humber via rivers, other streams run into the Bristol Channel. Toft is a Scandinavian word. The Vikings went up river and stoped at Wibtoft. Wibtoft is on the border of England and the rest was Viking, (last village of old England when it was divided between England and Denmark). The population has not changed since the first Doomsday Book, about 50.
